greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0) = 0; for n>=1, a(n)=least nonnegative integer x such that |x-a(n-1)|>=n and x is not a(k) for any k<n.
comment: A permutation of the nonnegative integers.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
program: f u v ws = g ws where
then g xs else x : f (u + 1) x (delete x ws)
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Jun 07 2002
